newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Arafat to meet EU "troika" in Luxembourg Monday. [CORRECTED 12:10 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Arafat to meet EU "troika" in Luxembourg Monday. [CORRECTED 12:10 GMT]

text.p: Palestinian President Yasser Arafat will meet the European Union's so-called troika of foreign minsters in Luxembourg on Monday night, EU diplomats said.

Diplomats said Arafat would meet the foreign ministers of Italy, Ireland and the Netherlands -- the past, current and next (Corrects from "former") presidencies of the 15-nation bloc -- ahead of a full EU foreign ministers meeting on Tuesday.
One EU diplomat said it was not clear whether Arafat's schedule would allow him to meet all the European Union's foreign ministers at their meeting on Tuesday.

"All we can say at the moment is that Arafat will meet with the troika tonight (Monday)," the diplomat said. "We would like him to stay and hold talks with the other ministers but we don't know if it is possible yet."
Some EU states have been angered at their exclusion from a summit meeting called by U.S. President Bill Clinton for Tuesday to try and save the Israeli-Palestinian peace accords.

Aarafat has asked Clinton to delay the proposed summit in Washington with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu but Israeli officials said Netanyahu was preparing to leave for the United States as planned.
